content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x equals, 2 times x cubed, minus x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions is the average rate of change of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 1 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of 3, plus f of 1, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of 3, plus f of 1, and denominator 3 plus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of 3, minus f of 1, and denominator 3 minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of 3, minus f of 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator f of 3, minus f of 1, and denominator 3 minus 1, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
